title: Deoghar ropeway accident: Man falls to death from IAF chopper during rescue operation - Times of India
content:
1. Deoghar ropeway accident: Man falls to death from IAF chopper during rescue operation  Times of India
  2. Jharkhand Cable Car Rescue Op Ends, 3 Dead, Over 40 Safe; Court Steps In  NDTV
  3. Carry out safety audit of all ropeway projects: MHA to states and UTs  Moneycontrol
  4. Jharkhand ropeway accident: Toll rises to 3 after woman falls off chopper; rescue operation ends  Times of India
  5. Jharkhand Ropeway Accident: Where Are The Drone Delivery Startups Now?  News18
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: Amidst a difficult rescue in Deoghar, came a terrible tragedy, after this man fell from a rescue chopper, seconds away from safety. He was among 48 people stranded in 12 cable cars in Jharkhand's Trikut hills. Watch as he is rescued from the cable car and dangling mid-air as he's being hauled up into the rescue chopper. Moments later he falls to his death. The Dumka resident has been identified. One woman who was injured has also died in the tragedy at India's highest vertical ropeway. Rescue operations were resumed at 5 am on Tuesday and at least 10 have been rescued.  Of late reports came that a lady also fell during the rescue operation and got injured.
